item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leak Reveals Six New Achievements in Version 2.3
item.description:
Highlights

  • Honkai: Star Rail is adding six new battle achievements to the game with the Version 2.3 update, according to recent leaks.
  • The new achievements will feature a mix of utilizing Firefly and Jade's skills in specific ways, as well as team-building challenges focused around the game's newest characters.
  • Version 2.3 is set to welcome multiple new events alongside the game's newest characters, including a new variant of the Simulated Universe.

A new leak from Honkai: Star Rail is detailing six new achievements players will be able to acquire following the release of the Version 2.3 update next month. The massively popular sci-fi RPG from HoYoverse boasts a wide variety of different achievements for players to claim within the game, offering Stellar Jades as rewards. Honkai: Star Rail achievements can range from clearing certain chapters of the game's main story to special challenges in combat, completed with specific characters or elements. Now, players will have a few new rewards to strive for with the game's upcoming update.

Version 2.3 of Honkai: Star Rail is already looking to be jam-packed with new content for the game. HoYoverse has confirmed the RPG will be receiving two new five-star characters during the update, with the long-awaited debut of Firefly and Jade set to appear. The update is also expected to welcome a wide array of new events, including the "Divergent Universe" as a new spin on the popular Simulated Universe game mode. Now, Star Rail 's newest characters will boast several achievements for players to pick up.

Related
Honkai: Star Rail 2.2 Chart Shows Most Picked Characters for Memory of Chaos

A comprehensive Honkai: Star Rail chart reveals the most popular characters for the latest version of the Memory of Chaos mode.

A new leak shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker HomDGCat is teasing six new combat achievements coming to Honkai: Star Rail . The new achievements will feature multiple challenges centered around individual mechanics, like using Firefly's "Firefly Type-IV: Deathstar Overload" skill and Jade's "Debt Collector" status . The update also offers several team-building achievements, including Firefly with the Stellaron Hunters and Jade with other IPC members. Honkai: Star Rail 's Version 2.3 is currently slated to launch on June 18.

Honkai: Star Rail Leaks Six New Achievements

  • ??? : Use ally Firefly in combat against boss Kafka and be Dominated by her.
  • ??? : Win 1 battle with a team comprising Firefly and the Trailblazer of any Path.
  • I Will Set the Seas Ablaze! : In a single battle, use Firefly Type-IV: Deathstar Overload 4 time(s) before the Complete Combustion state ends while using SAM.
  • Save the Cat : Win 1 battle with a team comprising Silver Wolf, Blade, Kafka, and Firefly.
  • Planet of Festivities Special Activities Division : Win 1 battle with a team comprising Topaz & Numby, Dr. Ratio, Aventurine, and Jade.
  • Fatal Contract : Reduce an ally's HP to 1 when they are under the Debt Collector effect from Jade's Skill in a single battle.

Honkai: Star Rail 's newest achievements will arrive as leaks have already begun to tease the future of Honkai: Star Rail throughout the Penacony cycle. A recent leak claimed that Star Rail is set to return to the Xianzhou Luofu in future updates, with several patches of Xianzhou Luofu characters planned to release. Multiple upcoming characters from the RPG's China-themed world have already seen early leaks, with Jiaoqiu and Feixiao teased as new roster members. Version 2.4 has also already seen early information surface about its cast, welcoming the highly-anticipated launch of Screwllum.

Firefly and Jade's addition to Honkai: Star Rail in Version 2.3 follows up a string of popular characters joining the RPG since Penacony's launch. New characters like Sparkle and Acheron have debuted as some of Honkai: Star Rail 's most powerful characters. Robin's launch was a particular highlight for many fans of Honkai: Star Rail , with HoYoverse releasing multiple music videos for the Version 2.2 five-star character. Firefly and Jade will look to see similar success to Star Rail 's recent characters when Version 2.3 arrives in June.

item.title: Skyrim Player Discovers Whiterun Guard in Unexpected Place
item.description:
Highlights

  • Skyrim's Creation Kit quirks have added charm and sometimes unexpected encounters, such as when a player discovered a Whiterun guard in Solstheim.
  • Fast travel can teleport NPCs with you, leading to them ending up in dangerous or unexpected places in Skyrim.
  • As Bethesda focuses on Elder Scrolls 6, fans hope for improved NPC schedules for a more immersive gaming experience.

A Skyrim player inexplicably runs into a Whiterun Guard on the island of Solstheim, a place far beyond Whiterun's jurisdiction. It has been over 12 years since Skyrim was released, and in the time since, it has proven to be the purest expression of what a Bethesda sandbox aspires to be. The Legendary Edition, Special Edition, and Anniversary Edition have all contributed to making Skyrim a polished experience for both Bethesda veterans and newcomers to The Elder Scrolls . However, there is an argument to be made that the quirks of the Creation Kit as an engine greatly add to Skyrim 's charm and appeal.

Though the Creation Kit has allowed Skyrim mods to completely transform the base game into a brand-new experience, it is also notorious for creating bizarre and chaotic situations. Given that the open world in a Bethesda sandbox lives and breathes outside the player's influence, it isn't outside the realm of possibility for the Dragonborn to be saved from a frost troll by a bear. The emergent gameplay in Skyrim also makes it clear that dragons can and will land on top of an unfortunate bystander when attacking a random settlement.

Related
How The Elder Scrolls 6 Can Elevate a Faction Skyrim Let Down

The Elder Scrolls 6 aims to improve upon Skyrim's RPG elements and that can be easily and effectively done by engaging with the Psijic Order.

However, the most recent Creation Kit incident belongs to a player named Who_Candice, who shared a screenshot of their Dragonborn coming across a Whiterun Guard on the island of Solstheim. Given that no Whiterun Guards are expected to spawn in Solstheim, which is under the jurisdiction of House Redoran, it makes this incident even more bizarre. That being said, there is a plausible explanation behind his unexpected appearance, and this logic also extends to other NPCs in Skyrim .

How Skyrim NPCs Can Accidentally End Up in the Wrong Place

When players use fast travel in Skyrim , if an NPC is in the middle of attempting to interact with them, they will actually teleport with the Dragonborn to the target destination. This can include dangerous places, or even areas well outside their daily schedule. Once finishing their interaction, the NPC will attempt to take the long way back home, and can often end up dying during the journey. It's quite possible that Who_Candice attempted to fast travel from Whiterun to Solstheim while the guard wanted to make a comment about the player's progress concerning the main quest.

With Starfield released, Bethesda's full focus is on developing the next Elder Scrolls title . Though the game is rumored to take place in Hammerfell, and even potentially High Rock as well, no province of Tamriel has yet been officially confirmed for the sequel. That being said, it can be expected that NPCs will follow complex schedules in The Elder Scrolls 6 , as they most likely won't be limited by procedurally generated instances the same way Starfield was.

item.title: Stardew Valley Player Shows Off Impressive Coffee Shop Design
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Stardew Valley fan gets creative, designing their own coffee shop in the game.
  • Players have noted the absence of key features like bathrooms in the Farm House and NPC homes, pushing for more expansions.
  • Despite missing elements, Stardew Valley continues to be a beloved indie gem with potential for even more growth in the future.

The beloved indie game Stardew Valley has been praised for its expansive worldbuilding, but the lack of an official coffee shop in its town center has inspired one fan to design their own charming cafe. Stardew Valley fan creations often take advantage of the game's impressive crafting and customization features, producing a number of fun showpieces like an in-game coffee shop.

First released in 2016, Stardew Valley is a farming life-sim game, beloved for its adorable pixel graphics, relatable characters, and wholesome storytelling. The game has received a number of big updates over the years, with developer Eric "ConcernedApe" Barone adding free content for fans to enjoy. However, many fans have lamented the lack of certain locales within the game's central town, resulting in some fans creating their own in-game shops.

Related
Stardew Valley Fan Creates Charming Junimo Nightlight

A creative Stardew Valley fan shares a look at their homemade nightlight styled after the game's beloved magical Junimo creatures.

Stardew Valley player WLOR decided that Pelican Town was in desperate need of a coffee shop, so they used the interior of a shed to design their own quaint cafe. The Stardrop Saloon in Stardew Valley serves as the main hub for the citizens of Pelican Town, though some players have felt the bar aesthetic is less than ideal for those wanting a more charming way to relax in the Valley. As such, WLOR creatively utilized a shed on their farm and transformed the small building into a cozy coffee shop. The simple yet welcoming design features coffee tones in its flooring and furniture, a bright fireplace surrounded by bookshelves, and a row of kegs ready to brew up freshly grown coffee beans. Fellow players have praised the design, with many hoping for an official cafe to one day make its way to Stardew Valley .

What's Missing in Stardew Valley?

With the release of Stardew Valley Update 1.6 , there is now more content than ever for players to explore, but fans have noticed a number of potential features still missing from Pelican Town. Aside from the lack of a coffee shop, some fans have pointed out the absence of bathrooms in the Farm House and NPC homes, with others questioning the lack of expansions to the Spa and Mines. Others have lamented the lack of new isles to explore beyond Pelican Town, with Ginger Island remaining the only locale players can frequently visit beyond the main playable map area. However, Stardew Valley fans remain incredibly pleased with the game and its substantial updates, with many content to add in these missed features in their own unique way.

Stardew Valley has grown massively since its initial launch and is considered by many to be both one of the best indie games and one of the best life-sim games of all time . It is unknown at this time if ConceredApe will add more content beyond small patches to Update 1.6, but there is plenty of potential for new locales and customization features to be added to Stardew Valley .

item.title: Elden Ring Player Is Role-Playing as Santa Claus During Invasions
item.description:
Highlights

  • One Elden Ring player recently embarked on a friendly invasion, role-playing as Santa Claus and bearing gifts.
  • Despite dropping 250,000 worth of runes and a Legendary Talisman, one of the opposing players refused to stop attacking them even after their ally tried to intervene.
  • The jolly player later revealed that they had previously performed numerous other Santa Claus invasions, with somewhat mixed results.

One creative Elden Ring player has recently decided to role-play as Santa Claus for an invasion. While his experiment yielded mixed results, it added to the ever-growing list of memorable multiplayer shenanigans that Elden Ring players have conjured up to date.

Like many other FromSoftware-made soulslikes, Elden Ring features a multiplayer system that allows for both cooperative and PvP play . No matter whether the player is assisting the Host of Fingers as a Furled Finger or invading them as a Bloody Finger, their reward for multiplayer success will always be a combination of a Rune Arc and some runes.

Related
Kai Cenat Beats Elden Ring's Malenia After a Stunning Number of Deaths

Victory is in sight for Kai Cenat's Elden Ring marathon after the streamer manages to triumph over Malenia following a stunning number of losses.

Elden Ring Player Attempts a Friendly Invasion as Santa Claus

And while most players would be happy to get runes, not everyone needs them these days. YouTuber Fiji_World can attest to that fact, having recently decided to get rid of some of his gargantuan rune reserves by dropping them to other players during an invasion, all the while cosplaying as Santa Claus. Aside from five Lord's Runes worth 250,000 runes in total, the content creator also opted to leave the Erdtree's Favor +2 Elden Ring talisman to the party that they ended up invading. The Furled Finger either didn't stop being suspicious about Fiji_World's motivations or didn't care, having kept attacking the friendly invader throughout his attempts to gift the host, as seen in the footage of the encounter that the YouTuber shared online.

But the Host of Fingers understood what was going on before long, having accepted the gifts and even attempted to prevent their Furled Finger from attacking by getting in front of them, although without much success. The unusual encounter recently found itself on the front page of the r/EldenRing subreddit, much to the amusement of the game's fandom. Fiji_World clarified that this wasn't the only occasion on which he invaded as an Elden Ring Santa Claus , having pointed to one of his late February 2024 videos which documents many such attempts, some more successful than others.

As for the specifics of his cosplay, the YouTuber opted to mimic the jolly gift-giver by combining the Fire Prelate Armor with the Olivinus Glintstone Crown. The latter isn't the only Elden Ring helm that allows for Santa Claus cosplay, as the Karolos Glintstone Crown has a similar stone beard look going on for it. Ditto for the Twinsage Glinstone Crown, though that one comes with two heads, so it would make for a bit more bizarre take on Santa Claus. The Olivinus Glintstone Crown can be obtained by defeating Glinstone Sorcered in the Raya Lucaria Academy, while the Fire Prelate Armor requires farming Fire Prelates in Fort Laiedd, Giant-Conquering Hero's Grave, or Guardians' Garrison.

item.title: Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Players Can Claim a New Limited-Time Distribution
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon Scarlet and Violet rolls out its newest limited-time distribution event, with a Quaxly based on the Pokemon Horizons anime.
  • Players can use Scarlet and Violet's in-game Mystery Gift function to redeem a code for a Level 5 Quaxly, inspired by the Pokemon used by Dot in Pokemon Horizons.
  • Pokemon Scarlet and Violet have previously featured Pokemon Horizons in its Mystery Gift distributions, giving out a Sprigatito based on Liko's Starter Pokemon.

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players can pick up a brand-new event Pokemon through the games' Mystery Gift function for a limited time, with a special Quaxly now available. While the newest entries in the monster-catching franchise introduced plenty of new creatures, Scarlet and Violet 's trio of Starter Pokemon have remained some of their most popular. The trio have featured heavily in both in-game promotions and the new Pokemon Horizons anime series accompanying the games. Now, one of the Paldean starters has become the game's newest limited-time event Pokemon.

The Pokemon franchise made major waves last year with the debut of Pokemon Horizons as its anime accompaniment to Pokemon Scarlet and Violet . The new season serves as the first time in Pokemon 's nearly 30-year history that the main-series anime did not star Ash Ketchum. Taking his place were the duo of Liko and Roy, with series mascot Pikachu returning to the anime as the sidekick of supporting character Friede. Now, an anime-inspired Quaxly is available for Scarlet and Violet players to claim for a limited time.

Related
New Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Limited-Time Distribution Announced

A new Pokemon Scarlet and Violet limited-time distribution is in the works, this time adding a Japan Championships Pokemon to gamers' teams.

As reported by NintendoLife , a new Mystery Gift distribution event is now available for Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , featuring Paldea starter Quaxly. The Quaxly is based on the Pokemon used by Pokemon Horizons supporting character Dot , arriving at Level 5 with Pound and Water Gun as its moves. The Quaxly sports Torrent as its ability, with a Water Tera Type and a Serious nature. Fans can claim the special event Quaxly starting today by using the code "D0T1STPARTNER" with an end date for the distribution event not yet confirmed.

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Giving Out Anime Quaxly

  • Distribution code: D0T1STPARTNER
  • Level 5
  • Ability: Torrent
  • Tera Type: Water
  • Moves: Pound, Water Gun
  • Available starting May 19
  • Original Trainer: Dot

The launch of an anime-themed event Quaxly would not be the first cross-promotion Pokemon Scarlet and Violet have done with the Pokemon Horizons anime. Earlier this year, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet debuted a distribution event for Paldea Grass Starter Sprigatito , based on the Pokemon used by Liko in the Pokemon anime. Mobile game Pokemon GO also launched a Pokemon Horizons -themed event earlier this year, with players able to pick up Captain Pikachu and Liko and Roy appearing in the photo mode.

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet 's newest anime crossover comes as the most recent of a plethora of distribution events in recent months. Pokemon 's ongoing Asia Championship has offered several exclusive and powerful Pokemon for players to pick up, including competitive-ready Pokemon like Talonflame and Gyarados. New seven-star Raids have also made special Pokemon available in-game, with Scarlet and Violet recently introducing the "Primarina the Unrivaled" raid. With multiple new events, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet fans have plenty of chances to add some new Pokemon to their collection.
